p: Tribolium confusum and Sitophilus zeamais were taken from the Laboratory of Entomology, Regional Research Center on Horticulture and Organic Agriculture, Chott-Mariem (CRRHAB), Tunisia. Insect adults were cultured in a growth cabinet set at the following rearing conditions: 28 ± 1 °C, 60% relative humidity (RI), 16 h light and 8 h dark photoperiod, without exposure to any insecticidal contamination. The food media used were wheat flour for T. confusum and whole maize grains for S. zeamais.
